alert.note: Alert for Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 23 at 7:40PM CDT until September 23 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN SEMINOLE...NORTH CENTRAL PONTOTOC AND WEST CENTRAL HUGHES COUNTIES... At 740 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sasakwa, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Francis, Sasakwa, and Spaulding. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
